intro: Psychotria lineolata, commonly known as the "Crimson Beauty" or "Lineolated Psychotria," is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, dark green leaves with distinctive white or pale veins, and it produces small, fragrant white flowers. Psychotria lineolata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments. It is also noted for its role in traditional medicine and as a host plant for certain butterfly species.
